summary: This document is an email chain from August 9, 2019, discussing technical issues with the NICEVision surveillance system software at multiple Federal Bureau of Prisons facilities. The emails are between staff at various federal correctional institutions and detention centers, including FCI Danbury, FDC Miami, FCWFDC Tallahassee, and FCI Otisville.

events.title: NICEVision System Error Reports
events.description: Multiple Federal Bureau of Prisons facilities report technical issues with the NICEVision surveillance system software, including database errors that prevent administrator access.

locations: Federal Correctional Institution Danbury, 33 Pembroke Road, Danbury, CT 06811
FDC Miami, 33 NE 4th Street, Miami, FL 33132
FCWFDC Tallahassee, 501 Capital Circle NE, Tallahassee, FL 32301
FCI Otisville, Two Mile Dr., Otisville, NY 10963
keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated August 9, 2019, concerning technical problems with the NICEVision surveillance software used in federal prisons.
Multiple Federal Bureau of Prisons facilities across the country (Danbury, Miami, Tallahassee, Otisville) are experiencing similar system errors.
The primary issue is a "Database Error" that prevents administrators from unlocking accounts and causes the application to close.
The emails suggest the NICEVision system is being implemented across the Bureau of Prisons, replacing or supplementing older systems like Vicon.
No specific individuals are named in the email text; all references are to institutional email addresses or generic staff positions.
